main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported in Dallas, Texas on various dates in April 1952.
interesting points: One report described the sighting of 4 red, 4 yellow, and 1 white circular objects making a 90-degree turn, with the observers speculating that the sighting may have been influenced by reading Life Magazine.

A reliable source, Major M, reported observing a bright metallic sphere or disc moving rapidly in a northerly direction before disappearing from view, and it was classified as an unidentified flying object.
A civilian reported sighting a light that appeared to be a colored object but yielded very little data to draw any conclusions.
A female civilian made a ground-visual report, and it was noted that the source had previously made similar reports.

An object, approximately 3 feet in diameter and hovering at an altitude of around 1,000 feet, was observed from the roof of a building in Dallas. It appeared to be metallic in color and was seen for approximately 5 minutes before disappearing.
witnesses: military personnel, civilians, and a female civilian
photographs: no visible photographs in the records
